version.description:
The Unicode Consortium accepted the following emoji 72 emojis for Unicode 9.0. This update was released on June 21, 2016. Most vendors added support for this update within the 2016 calendar year. Sample images and more about Unicode 9.0.

Emoji 4.0 was published in late 2016, which added additional emoji professions.

New in Unicode 9

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Portrait and role symbols

emoji_net_data.name: person playing water polo

bn:00042379n: Chemical compound formed of molecules composed of two atoms of hydrogen and one of oxygen

Binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent
The liquid form of this chemical; liquid H?O.
Common liquid (H?O) which forms rain, rivers, the sea, etc., and which makes up a large part of the bodies of organisms.
Water is a common chemical substance, that is essential to all known forms of life.
Water is a transparent fluid which forms the world's streams, lakes, oceans and rain, and is the major constituent of the fluids of living things.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the person playing water polo emoji captures dynamic action with a sense of energetic movement. The figure is rendered with Appleâ€™s signature glossy 3D shading, highlighting the rippling water and the athlete's determined expression. Soft rounded edges on the body and the splash of water create a realistic, engaging visual that conveys athleticism and participation in aquatic sports.
